message_1: What is the value of x in the equation 7^x = 6 (mod 13)?
message_2:
To find the value of x in the equation 7^x = 6 (mod 13), we can use trial and error to find the smallest positive integer x that satisfies the equation.

1. 7^1 = 7 (mod 13)
2. 7^2 = 49 ≡ 10 (mod 13)
3. 7^3 = 343 ≡ 5 (mod 13)
4. 7^4 = 2401 ≡ 9 (mod 13)
5. 7^5 = 16807 ≡ 8 (mod 13)
6. 7^6 = 117649 ≡ 11 (mod 13)
7. 7^7 = 823543 ≡ 12 (mod 13)
8. 7^8 = 5764801 ≡ 4 (mod 13)
9. 7^9 = 40353607 ≡ 3 (mod 13)
10. 7^10 = 282475249 ≡ 2 (mod 13)
11. 7^11 = 1977326743 ≡ 1 (mod 13)
12. 7^12 = 13841287201 ≡ 7 (mod 13)
13. 7^13 = 96889010407 ≡ 6 (mod 13)

So, the value of x in the equation 7^x = 6 (mod 13) is x = 13.
